(numRasEntries, numRobEntries).explanation: The Return Address Stack (RAS) for branch prediction and the Reorder Buffer (ROB) for out-of-order execution operate independently in different pipeline stages with no direct causal relationship;

(numRasEntries, nL2TLBEntries).explanation: RAS entries for return address prediction and L2 TLB entries for virtual-to-physical address translation serve completely different functions in the processor pipeline with no causal dependency;

(numRasEntries, ICacheMiss).explanation: A larger RAS improves return address prediction accuracy, reducing mispredicted returns that would otherwise cause instruction cache misses when fetching from incorrect addresses;
